poem:
"Anemoia on Oxford Street"

Beneath London's misty shroud,
naked, toughened branches.
A glimmering prism of past lives
in the rhythm of passersby.
Dreams, untraveled, etched
on the deep lines of Oxford Street -
Anemoia, we dance in your arms,
in a love not our own, 
but of time, ghostly charades.
Adrift in a yearning,
not yet written.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The big picture: layers of nostalgia on London’s Oxford Street Stephen Leslie has an occasional YouTube channel on which he talks about photographs he likes – some his own, some by photographers he admires. In one recent episode he featured this picture, which he took on Oxford Street in London in February 2018. The theme of that YouTube chat was the idea of anemoia, a niche form of nostalgia that prompts a yearning for a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
